column4: anyone know how to reset a init or something without restarting my comp? my computer thinks there is an ftp server when there isnt

yes I am thoroughly confused, I try to start my vsftpd server and it says it cant bind port 21, i dont have any other ftp server isntalled although i did uninstall one when i installed  vsftpd, That server may have been running when I uninstalled it so i wasnt sure if that was the cause
I did sudo when I attempt to run the server
do a 'nestat -ant', and look for port 21
so you have an ftp server running
try netstat -antp to see what's running on port 21
OK now its showing as vsftpd, and for one reason or another I can now login to my ftp, thanks!
i think apt-get / dpkg / whatever starts it on install
I was just confused cause I tried to connect before and had no luck
